committees.title: Audit Committee
committees.purpose: · Monitors the work of the internal audit team, including risk management and assurance. · Monitors Audit Commission reports. · Responsible for, risk management, the statement of internal control and signing off the final accounts.

committees.title: Cabinet
committees.purpose: · Makes operational decisions within council policy and proposes the annual budget. · Receives recommendations from the scrutiny committees and task groups. Recommends new policies to council and decides how they are delivered within agreed budgets. · The work programme is updated each month. · Members have specialist areas of interest (portfolios). · Meets in public every month apart from August.

committees.title: Appointments Committee.
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Oversees the recruitment/appointment process for senior officers and makes appointment recommendations/decisions in line with the Council's constitution.

committees.title: Standards Panel
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Supports and determines matters relating to member conduct and standards, including hearings/panels where applicable.

committees.title: Constitution
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Maintains and oversees the Council's Constitution and associated governance arrangements, ensuring it remains current and fit for purpose.

committees.title: Full Council
committees.purpose: · Decides key strategic policies. · Sets budgets. · Agrees changes to the constitution. · Appoints committees, the leader and deputy leader and members to external bodies. · Meets in public 6 times a year.

committees.title: Licensing Committee
committees.purpose: · Quasi judicial (has some limited legal powers). · Determines those licensing applications not determined by the Head of Health and Environment under the Council’s officer delegation scheme. · Meetings take place in public as and when necessary following receipt of representations (objections). · Will hold hearings into applications for licences.

committees.title: Development Management Committee
committees.purpose: · Quasi judicial (has some limited legal powers). · Determines those planning applications not determined by the Group Manager for Planning and Housing under the Council’s officer delegation scheme. · Advises on planning policy and operations. · Meets in public every month.

committees.title: Overview and Scrutiny Committee
committees.purpose: · Deals with issues relating to the planning, performance and management of council services, including value for money and issues affecting the local community. · Checks on the Cabinet’s work as a critical friend. · Focuses on policy review and development alongside scrutiny of external organisations. · Forms permanent working groups and task groups to look at particular issues. · Meets in public six times a year.
